title: 4 questions facing Bruins as they return from Olympic break
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Bruins have 25 games remaining in the 2025-26 season, starting against the Columbus Blue Jackets at TD Garden.
Boston sits in the second Eastern Conference Wild Card spot with a 32-20-5 record, aiming to secure a playoff position.
Boston faces challenges with a weak penalty kill and high penalty minutes as they consider trade options before the March 6 deadline.

title: Fire erupts at MCI-Norfolk prison, no major injuries reported
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Fire erupted in a housing unit at MCI-Norfolk prison; Norfolk Fire Department responded at 1:30 p.m.
Three incarcerated individuals received on-site treatment for smoke inhalation; one staff member went to a hospital for evaluation.
The fire's cause is unknown, under investigation; officials are assessing damage and potential housing impacts at the prison.

title: Stephen A. Smith endorses Jaylen Brown as an MVP candidate
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stephen A. Smith supports Jaylen Brown as an MVP candidate for the 2025-26 NBA season.
Despite roster changes, the Celtics are second in the Eastern Conference with a 38-19 record.
Jaylen Brown averages 29.2 points, 7.0 rebounds, and 4.9 assists per game during a career year.

title: Harvard professor on leave as college investigates ties to Jeffrey Epstein
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Harvard Professor Martin Nowak placed on paid leave amid new investigation into ties with Jeffrey Epstein.
Nowak received $6.5 million from Epstein for Harvard's Program for Evolutionary Dynamics and visited Epstein's island in 2013.
Former Harvard president Larry Summers resigned after DOJ documents revealed his connections to Epstein.

title: Malden educator, basketball coach charged with rape in incident involving high school student, officials say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Scott Marino, a Malden educator and basketball coach, was arrested and charged with rape and indecent assault.
Marino was placed on leave after Malden police informed the district of the investigation on February 19.
The Middlesex District Attorney’s Office is handling the case; the district declined further comment citing privacy laws.

title: Red Sox’ Wilyer Abreu explains viral broken-bat check swing
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Wilyer Abreu's bat broke during a check swing against the Pittsburgh Pirates, a rare occurrence that left him surprised.
Abreu suspected bat damage from a previous at-bat could have caused the break despite no prior signs of a problem.
Last season, Abreu hit 22 home runs and won his second consecutive Golden Glove despite playing only 115 games.

title: All Mass. customers should have power fully restored by end of Friday night, Eversource says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: 160,000 Eversource customers in Massachusetts were without power following a blizzard, focusing outages in Cape Cod and Martha's Vineyard.
Eversource expects power restoration by Friday midnight for areas like Wellfleet, Yarmouth, and Barnstable after the Monday storm.
National Grid aims to restore power by Wednesday night, with 71,000 of 90,000 outages addressed, mostly affecting Nantucket.

title: Team USA captain Hilary Knight reacts to Trump’s ‘distasteful’ joke about U.S. women’s hockey team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Team USA women's hockey captain Hilary Knight criticized Donald Trump's joke about the team as 'distasteful.'
Both U.S. men's and women's hockey teams won gold at the 2026 Winter Olympics, defeating Canada 2-1 in overtime.
The U.S. women's team declined Trump's invitation to the State of the Union due to prior commitments.

title: Mike Vrabel on AJ Brown, Stefon Diggs’ future and Patriots’ free agency approach
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots coach Mike Vrabel discussed the team's free agency approach, emphasizing the importance of acquiring talented players with strong character.
Stefon Diggs' future with the Patriots is uncertain, as his $6 million roster bonus becomes guaranteed on March 13.
Mike Vrabel values his relationship with Eagles receiver A.J. Brown, who has been speculated as a Patriots trade target.

title: Charania: Jayson Tatum a ‘full-go’ during Celtics’ 5-on-5 scrimmages
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum participates fully in Celtics' 5-on-5 scrimmages, nearing return after Achilles injury.
Tatum remains without a set return date; recovery progressing with full practice participation.
Celtics will clear Tatum for games once he confirms readiness, focusing on physical and mental recovery.
